intro: Anthopterus verticillatus, commonly known as the spiral wort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its whorled arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Anthopterus verticillatus is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
